Factor Model (Diagonally weighted least-squares)

Source: vignettes/estimators_factor_model_dwls.qmd

Parametrization

R=S−Ŝ(θ) R = S -\hat{S}(\theta)

Loss

loss=0.5∥W⊙R∥2 loss = 0.5 \, \left \lVert W \odot R \right \rVert^2

Gradient

ΔŜ(θ)=−W⊙R \Delta_{\hat{S}(\theta)} = -W \odot R

Differential of the gradient

∂ΔŜ(θ)=W⊙∂Ŝ(θ) \partial\Delta_{\hat{S}(\theta)} = W \odot \partial \hat{S}(\theta)

Hessian

HŜ(θ)=diag(vec(W)) H_{\hat{S}(\theta)} = \operatorname{diag}(\operatorname{vec}(W))
